page.title: 07Farming
page.content: Big landowners own part of the area: cupho Hall farm and Tuddenham Hall farm are parts of larger concerns. Hill House Farm, Playford, is privately farmed with Grove Farm, Little Bealings. Mixed farming, including 2000 pigs under cover. Clay/sandy soil, irrigated in summer, but alluvial soil, in River Fynn valley is wet, needing drains. Lands of Kiln farm, Kesgrae - private. Poor sandy soil, summer irrigation from 250' well. Barley, sugar beet, potatoes Lux Farm, Playford, privately farmed for 46 years. 430 acres of mixed farming, watere from mains supply. Manor arm, little Bealings - tenant famers for 30 years. 120 acres. Corn, suggar beet, 30 store cattle. EEC 40% grant or 2\ million gallon resrvoir filled in winter from River Lark 23/48.
